Always returns `IERC721Receiver.onERC721Received.selector`."},"owner()":{"details":"Returns the address of the current owner."},"pendingOwner()":{"details":"Returns the address of the pending owner."},"proxiableUUID()":{"details":"Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier."},"randomFromSignature(bytes32,uint8,bytes32,bytes32)":{"params":{"_hash":"The hash to sign","_r":"signature R field","_s":"signature S field","_v":"signature V field"},"returns":{"_random":"The pseudo-random number"}},"renounceOwnership()":{"details":"Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner."},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. acceptOwnership().details: The new owner accepts the ownership transfer.

enableRecruitments(uint256,uint256,uint2.details: Can be called only by the contract owner/admin

params._endTime: The end time of the recruitment cycle
params._startTime: The start time of the recruitment cycle

enableRecruitments(uint256[]).details: Can be called only by the contract owner/admin

endRecruitment(bytes32,uint8,bytes32,byt.details: Can be called only during an active recruitment, after the cooldown is overThe final color is determined randomly, and affected by the influence amounts

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

influenceRecruitment(bytes32,uint8,bytes.details: Can be called only during an active recruitmentImplements a cooldown before allowing to re-influenceThe max influence amount is determined by Pass Tier

returns._0: Whether the user has an active influence
Whether the user has an active recruitment

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

pendingOwner().details: Returns the address of the pending owner.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

startRecruitment(address,uint256).details: Not all badges are eligible for recruitment at the same timeDefines a cooldown for the recruitment to be completethe cooldown is lesser the higher the Pass TierMust be called from the s1 badges contract

params._hash: The hash to sign of the signature
The hash to sign of the signature

transferOwnership(address).details: Starts the ownership transfer of the contract to a new account. Replaces the pending transfer if there is one. Can only be called by the current owner.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

enableRecruitments(uint256[]).notice: Enable recruitments for a set of badges

generateClaimHash(uint8,address,uint256).notice: Generate a unique hash for each recruitment uniquely

getActiveRecruitmentFor(address).notice: Get the active recruitment for a user

getRecruitmentInfluences(address).notice: Get the recruitment influence counts for a user

influenceRecruitment(bytes32,uint8,bytes.notice: Influence (alter) the chances during a recruitment

isInfluenceActive(address).notice: Check if a influence is active for a user

isRecruitmentActive(address).notice: Check if a recruitment is active for a user

maxInfluences(uint256).notice: Get the maximum number of influences for a given experience

randomFromSignature(bytes32,uint8,bytes3.notice: Generates a random number from a signature

randomSigner().notice: Wallet authorized to sign as a source of randomness

startRecruitment(address,uint256).notice: Start a recruitment for a badge

startRecruitment(bytes32,uint8,bytes32,b.notice: Start a recruitment for a badge using the user's experience points
